info.description: These services provide APIs to interact with transaction
info.title: HCL Commerce Transaction server Services

externalDocs.description:
Some REST services require authentication. HCL Commerce REST services are authenticated on secure and unsecured channels. This authentication can include the use of the WCToken and WCTrustedToken. To use REST services that require authentication, you must first get authentication data by using a supported identity services.

After you obtain the authentication data, you must pass either the WCToken or WCTustedToken parameters, or both, within the HTTP header for every request that requires authentication. If a request is sent over HTTP, pass the WCToken parameter in the HTTP header. Do not pass the WCTrustedToken in HTTP requests, as the parameter value might display. Send both the WCToken and the WCTrustedToken parameters when the request is being sent over HTTPS.

The HCL Commerce REST APIs can also use session cookies that are created by the HCL Commerce store runtime for authentication. These cookies allow you to mix requests to the HCL Commerce REST APIs and the HCL Commerce store runtime within the same user session.

tags.name: Order
tags.description: Provides RESTful services to get order history and details.

tags.name: Inventory Availability
tags.description: Provides RESTful services to get inventory availability details for products. It performs the service by delegating to the InventoryAvailability BOD service.

tags.name: Wishlist
tags.description: Provides RESTful services to get and manage a shopper's wish lists. Note: You must enable the multiple wish lists feature in the Management Center Store Management tool.

get.description: Gets the order history for the authenticated user.

parameters.name: storeId
parameters.description: The store identifier.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The user identifier.

parameters.name: responseFormat
parameters.description: The response format. Valid values are json and xml. If the request contains an input body, it must use the format specified in responseFormat. If the responseFormat is not specified, the accept  HTTP header determines the format of the response. If the accept  HTTP header is not specified then default response format is json.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: Page number. Valid values are positive integers starting at 1. Use pageNumber with pageSize.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Page size. Used to limit the amount of data returned by a query. Valid values are integers starting with 1. Use pageSize with pageNumber.

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: The currency code to use for example, currency=USD. If no currency code is specified, the store default currency is used.

400.description: Bad request. The request could not be understood by the server due to malformed syntax.

401.description: Not authenticated. The user session is not valid.

403.description: The user is not authorized to perform the specified request.

500.description: Internal server error. For details, see the server log files.

get.description: Gets inventory details for the specified product by its identifier (PartNumber). Multiple partNumbers can be passed to the URI separated by a comma (,).

parameters.name: storeId
parameters.description: The store identifier.

parameters.name: partNumbers
parameters.description: The product identifiers. Multiple values are separated by commas for example, /inventoryavailability/'AuroraWMDRS-1,'AuroraWMDRS-2.

parameters.name: sellerId
parameters.description: The Marketplace Seller ID. Multiple values are separated by commas. Example: sellerId=1,2

parameters.name: responseFormat
parameters.description: The response format. Valid values are json and xml. If the request contains an input body, it must use the format specified in responseFormat. If the responseFormat is not specified, the accept  HTTP header determines the format of the response. If the accept  HTTP header is not specified then default response format is json.

parameters.name: onlineStoreName
parameters.description: The online store name.

parameters.name: physicalStoreName
parameters.description: The physical store names. Separate multiple values with a comma for example, physicalStoreName=China mall,Sales mall.

parameters.name: forUser
parameters.description: User name to act on behalf of.

parameters.name: forUserId
parameters.description: User identifier to act on behalf of.

400.description: Bad request. The request could not be understood by the server due to malformed syntax.

401.description: Not authenticated. The user session is not valid.

404.description: If any of the specified product identifiers could not be found, or none of the specified online/physical stores exist.

delete.summary: Delete wish list or wish list item
delete.description: Deletes a wish list or delete an item from a wish list. Specify an itemId or a productId to delete only that item from the wish list; otherwise the entire wish list is deleted. When both itemId and productId are provided, itemId is used ONLY.

parameters.name: storeId
parameters.description: The store identifier.

parameters.name: externalId
parameters.description: Wish list external identifier.

parameters.name: responseFormat
parameters.description: The response format. Valid values are json and xml. If the request contains an input body, it must use the format specified in responseFormat. If the responseFormat is not specified, the accept  HTTP header determines the format of the response. If the accept  HTTP header is not specified then default response format is json.

parameters.name: itemId
parameters.description: Specifies the ID of the wish list item to delete. If this parameter and productId are missing or blank, the entire wish list is deleted.

parameters.name: productId
parameters.description: Specifies the id of the wish list product to delete. If this parameter and itemId are missing or blank, the entire wish list is deleted.

400.description: Bad request. The request could not be understood by the server due to malformed syntax.

401.description: Not authenticated. The user session is not valid.

403.description: The user is not authorized to perform the specified request.

500.description: Internal server error. For details, see the server log files.

get.summary: Get order to work onbehalf of
get.description: Allows CSRs to find orders to work on behalf of a shopper.

parameters.description: The store identifier.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: The query name.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: The order Id.

parameters.name: orderItemId
parameters.description: The order item identifier.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: the user ID.

parameters.name: profileName
parameters.description: Profile name. Profiles determine the subset of data returned by a query. The default profile name = IBM_Summary.

parameters.name: orderByTableName
parameters.description: The order by table name.

parameters.name: orderByFieldName
parameters.description: The order by field name.

parameters.name: extOrderId
parameters.description: The external order identifier.

parameters.name: recordSetTotal
parameters.description: The total number of records in set.

parameters.name: retrievalOrderStatus
parameters.description: The order status to use for the retrieval of orders.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: Page number, starting at 1. Valid values include positive integers of 1 and above. The "pageSize" must be specified for paging to work.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Page size. Used to limit the amount of data returned by a query. Valid values include positive integers of 1 and above. The "pageNumber" must be specified for paging to work.

parameters.name: startIndex
parameters.description: The starting index of the result.

parameters.name: retrievePendingGuestOrders
parameters.description: Whether to retrieve pending guest orders or to exclude them. When set to true, only pending orders placed by guest users will be returned. Default value is false. This parameter will be ignored when the 'status' parameter is set.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: The order status. If 'status' is set, the 'retrievePendingGuestOrders' parameter will be ignored.

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return.

com.ibm.commerce.rest.order.handler.Merc.description: Description of the merchant validation input body.

status.description: A list of order status to be included in the export. This is the status of the order, not the status of the individual order item within the order. The default is null which does not consider the order status.

timePlacedInDays.description: The number of days to set back for the time placed of the order. 0 means exporting all the orders for today, 1 means exporting all the orders starting from yesterday, 2 means 2 days ago until now.

exportId.description: Export ID returned from the order export. It can be used in the order download REST API.

announcement.description: The email announcements made about the gift list by the registrants to friends and family.

com.ibm.commerce.rest.wishlist.handler.W.description: Description of the post input body to process the wish list.

item.description: Wish list item to add or updated.

com.ibm.commerce.rest.wishlist.handler.W.description: Description of the post input body to update the wishlist or item.

senderEmailAddress.description: The e-mail address of the sender.

message.description: The custom message sent by the sender in the e-mail.

item.description: Wish list item to add or update.

sendEmail.description: The flag to indicate to send email or not.

com.ibm.commerce.rest.order.handler.Orde.description: Information required to add CSR comment.

addressingMethod.description: The method in which the recipient is addressed in the e-mail, for example, they are directly addressed (TO), they are copied on the mail (CC), and so on.

item.description: Wish list item to add or update.

com.ibm.commerce.rest.wishlist.handler.W.description: Description of the post input body to create a wish list or item.

item.description: Wish list item to add or update.

Empty.description: Empty model. Used as default value when no model is specified.

gettingstarted.content: HCL Commerce REST services support JSON and XML formats for input and output data by default. The default format is JSON. When an XML String is sent to a REST service, you must set Content-Type HTTP header to be "application/xml". The REST service converts the XML input data to the JSON format that is accepted by REST services. Therefore, your input XML format must follow a certain structure so that it can be transformed to the JSON object that is accepted by REST services. See more here:
gettingstarted.name: Response formats

gettingstarted.content: Preview tokens are encrypted strings that encapsulates a set of preview options and restrictions on when and where the token can be used. Any user who is authorized to access your server and has a preview token, can complete preview actions in the same store for which that token is generated. See more here:
gettingstarted.name: Preview tokens

gettingstarted.content: Some HCL Commerce REST services require a request to be sent over HTTPS. Learn more here:
gettingstarted.name: Secure Sockets Layer
